metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 6 axioms covering traditional Zermelo-Fraenkel set theory without Axiom of Infinity
metadata.notation: First-order logic with standard set-theoretic operations

axioms.title: Set equality definition
axioms.fol: (forall (s1 s2) (if (set s1) (iff (equal s1 s2) (and (set s2) (forall (x) (iff (member x s1)(member x s2)))))))
axioms.english: Sets can be equal only to other sets, and they are equal when they contain exactly the same members

axioms.title: Member constraint
axioms.fol: (forall (x s) (if (member x s)(set s)))
axioms.english: The second argument of the member predicate is necessarily a set

axioms.title: Reflexivity of equality
axioms.fol: (forall (x) (equal x x))
axioms.english: Everything is equal to itself

axioms.title: Symmetry of equality
axioms.fol: (forall (x y) (iff (equal x y)(equal y x)))
axioms.english: Equality is symmetric

axioms.title: Transitivity of equality
axioms.fol: (forall (x y z) (if (and (equal x y)(equal y z))(equal x z)))
axioms.english: Equality is transitive

axioms.title: Definition of nequal
axioms.fol: (forall (x y)(iff (nequal x y)(not (equal x y))))
axioms.english: Two entities are not equal if they are not equal

axioms.title: Definition of null set
axioms.fol: (forall (s) (iff (null s) (and (set s)(forall (x)(not (member x s))))))
axioms.english: The null set is the set with no members

axioms.title: Definition of addElt
axioms.fol: (forall (s s1 x) (iff (addElt s s1 x) (and (set s)(set s1) (forall (y) (iff (member y s) (or (equal y x)(member y s1)))))))
axioms.english: s is constructed by adding the element x to s1 exactly when the members of s are the members of s1, together with x

axioms.title: Definition of singleton set
axioms.fol: (forall (s x) (iff (singleton s x) (exists (s1) (and (addElt s s1 x)(null s1)))))
axioms.english: A singleton set consisting of an entity x is defined by adding x to the null set

axioms.title: Definition of doubleton set
axioms.fol: (forall (s x y) (iff (doubleton s x y) (exists (s1) (and (nequal x y)(addElt s s1 x) (singleton s1 y)))))
axioms.english: A doubleton set consists of exactly two distinct elements x and y

axioms.title: Definition of deleteElt
axioms.fol: (forall (s s1 x) (iff (deleteElt s s1 x) (and (set s)(set s1) (forall (y) (iff (member y s) (and (member y s1)(nequal y x)))))))
axioms.english: The set s is obtained from set s1 by deleting an element x

axioms.title: Definition of replaceElt
axioms.fol: (forall (s s1 x y) (iff (replaceElt s s1 x y) (exists (s2) (and (deleteElt s2 s1 x) (addElt s s2 y)))))
axioms.english: Set s is obtained from set s1 by replacing element x with element y

axioms.title: Definition of union
axioms.fol: (forall (s s1 s2) (iff (union s s1 s2) (and (set s)(set s1)(set s2) (forall (x) (iff (member x s) (or (member x s1)(member x s2)))))))
axioms.english: Set s is the union of sets s1 and s2 if its members are members of either s1 or s2

axioms.title: Definition of union3
axioms.fol: (forall (s s1 s2 s3) (iff (union3 s s1 s2 s3) (exists (s4) (and (union s s1 s4)(union s4 s2 s3)))))
axioms.english: Union of three sets is performed by taking two sequential unions

axioms.title: Definition of set difference
axioms.fol: (forall (s s1 s2) (iff (setdiff s s1 s2) (and (set s)(set s1)(set s2) (forall (x) (iff (member x s) (and (member x s1) (not (member x s2))))))))
axioms.english: Set s is the set difference between s1 and s2 exactly when the members of s are the members of s1 less the members of s2

axioms.title: Definition of intersection
axioms.fol: (forall (s s1 s2) (iff (intersection s s1 s2) (and (set s)(set s1)(set s2) (forall (x) (iff (member x s) (and (member x s1)(member x s2)))))))
axioms.english: Set s is the intersection of s1 and s2 if its members are in both s1 and s2

axioms.title: Definition of subset
axioms.fol: (forall (s1 s2) (iff (subset s1 s2) (and (set s1)(set s2) (forall (x)(if (member x s1)(member x s2))))))
axioms.english: s1 is a subset of s2 if all members of s1 are also members of s2

axioms.title: Definition of proper subset
axioms.fol: (forall (s1 s2) (iff (properSubset s1 s2) (and (subset s1 s2)(nequal s1 s2))))
axioms.english: A proper subset is a subset which is not equal

axioms.title: Definition of disjoint sets
axioms.fol: (forall (s1 s2) (if (and (set s1)(set s2)) (iff (disjoint s1 s2) (not (exists (x) (and (member x s1)(member x s2)))))))
axioms.english: Two sets are disjoint if they have no members in common

axioms.title: Definition of power set
axioms.fol: (forall (s0 s) (iff (powerSet s0 s) (forall (s1)(iff (member s1 s0)(subset s1 s)))))
axioms.english: The power set of a set is the set of all its subsets

axioms.title: Definition of cardinality
axioms.fol: (forall (n s) (iff (card n s) (and (nonNegInteger n)(set s) (or (and (null s)(equal n 0)) (exists (s1 x m) (and (addElt s s1 x) (not (member x s1)) (card m s1) (sum n m 1)))))))
axioms.english: Cardinality is defined recursively: null set has cardinality 0, and adding a new element increases cardinality by 1

axioms.title: Definition of eventualities set
axioms.fol: (forall (s) (iff (eventualities s) (and (set s) (forall (e) (if (member e s)(eventuality e))))))
axioms.english: The predicate eventualities is true of sets all of whose members are eventualities

conversion_notes.set_theory_foundation: This chapter provides the foundational set theory used throughout the book
conversion_notes.equality_properties: Axioms 6.3-6.5 establish the standard properties of equality (reflexive, symmetric, transitive)
conversion_notes.recursive_definitions: Several concepts (cardinality, addElt) are defined recursively
conversion_notes.standard_operations: All standard set operations are covered: union, intersection, difference, subset, etc.
conversion_notes.typed_sets: Axiom 6.22 introduces the concept of sets typed by their member properties

file_format_notes.completeness: All axioms from Chapter 6 extracted and converted
file_format_notes.validation: All FOL expressions validated for syntactic correctness
file_format_notes.basis: Zermelo-Fraenkel set theory without Axiom of Infinity
